title: Young Woman Kneeling
credit_line: Gift of Marshall and Wallis Katz
provenance_text:
Aristide Maillol [1861-1944], Banyuls-sur-Mer, Roussillon, France. Gallery in Paris, France, possibly Galerie Hervé, Paris, France, possibly 1950s [1]; Mr. [c.1913-1991] and Mrs. Joseph M. Katz (Agnes Katz), Pittsburgh, PA and New York, NY, possibly 1950s but by November 1968 [2]; by descent to Marshall P. Katz, Pittsburgh, PA, until December 12, 2012; gift to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, December 2012.

Notes:
[1]. See curatorial file for correspondence from Marshall P. Katz.
[2]. Mr. and Mrs. Joseph M. Katz lent the sculpture (no. 49) to the exhibition "Sculpture We Live with: Privately Owned in the Pittsburgh Area" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, November 1968 - January 1969.
